Plot: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.
Title: Monsters, Inc.
Writer: Pete Docter (original story by), Jill Culton (original story by), Jeff Pidgeon (original story by), Ralph Eggleston (original story by), Andrew Stanton (screenplay), Daniel Gerson (screenplay)
Actors: John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Mary Gibbs, Steve Buscemi
tomatoConsensus: Clever, funny, and delightful to look at, Monsters, Inc. delivers another resounding example of how Pixar elevated the bar for modern all-ages animation.
Director: Pete Docter, David Silverman, Lee Unkrich
